content: I have made my first Logical Model and I'm trying to get it included in my Implementation Guide. I went back and looked at the Zulip history and I'm not sure if IGs can have Logical models but mine certainly isn't displaying very well.
certainly it should work. How is it not displaying very well?
well, I have a page with my model that shows no elements
i tried to copy my logical model based off of the models that are found in the core spec (specifically, Definition).
showing no elements isn't quite the intent. It's kind of a fake news mode

Might it be that I'm not putting it in the right directory in the input?
To verify, my baseDefinition should be 'Element' right?

Grahame Grieve said:

showing no elements isn't quite the intent. It's kind of a fake news mode

Just to follow up, I found your response funny, but I want to confirm that it is supposed to display semi-nicely so I'm doing something wrong since I'm not getting any content?
yes definitely something is wrong. You should get a display like this:
https://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/cda-core-2.0/StructureDefinition-ClinicalDocument.html - this IG is all logical models
you have the base definition as Base instead of Element
does that matter? it shouldn't? (though Base would probably match your intent better)

well, i get an error when I change it to Base. :)

There is something wonky going on because my StructureDefinition has all of the information and is then being converted into a StructureDefinition that has nothing in it.
StructureDefinition-LabelerLogicalModel.json StructureDefinition-LabelerLogicalModel.json

First one is input, second one is output
